tools: 一种你所选择的工匠工具 或 一种你所选择的乐器

default: (a)一把{@item 短剑|phb} 或 (b)任意一把{@filter 简易武器|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a)一套{@item 地城探险家套装|phb} 或 (b)一套{@item 探索者套装|phb}

classFeatures.name: 无甲防御
entries: 从1级开始，当你未穿戴护甲且未持用盾牌时，你的AC等于10 + 你的敏捷调整值 + 你的感知调整值。

classFeatures.name: 武艺
entries: 你在武术上的练习让你掌握了使用徒手打击和武僧武器的战斗方式，武僧武器包含了{@item 短剑|phb}和任何并不具有双手或重型属性的简易近战武器。
当你徒手或只持用武僧武器，且未穿戴护甲或持用盾牌时，你获得下列好处：

items: 你可以在徒手打击和武僧武器中使用敏捷而非力量来计算其攻击检定和伤害骰。
你可以骰一颗{@dice d4}以取代你徒手打击或武僧武器的伤害。这颗骰子会随着你提升武僧等级时变化，参见武僧表中的武艺栏位。
当你在你的回合以徒手打击或一把武僧武器采取{@action 攻击}动作，你能够以附赠动作进行一次徒手打击。举例来说，若你采取{@action 攻击}动作并使用{@item 长棍|phb}进行攻击，只要你在该回合尚未采取附赠动作，你就能够以一个附赠动作再进行一次徒手打击。

entries: 某些宗派会使用特别外型的武僧武器。举例来说，你可能使用二截用短炼相连的木棍（名为双节棍）、或一个刀刃较短而直的镰刀（名为单镰）。

classFeatures.name: 气
entries: 从2级开始，你所受的训练让你得以驾驭这被称为气的神秘能量。你对于这股能量的掌握体现为你拥有一定数量的气。你的武僧等级将决定你所拥有的气的数量，参见武僧表中的气的栏位。
你可以消耗这些气以驱动多种与气有关能力。你一开始知晓三个这类能力：疾风连击、坚强防御、以及飞檐走壁。你将在你于本职业升至特定等级时学到更多与气有关的能力。
当你消耗一点气时，直到你完成一次短休或长休前你都无法再使用被消耗的气，且你将在短休或长休结束的时候恢复所有你花费掉的气。你必须在休息中花费至少30分钟的时间冥想才能恢复你的气。
某些与气有关的能力会要求你的目标进行一次豁免检定对抗该能力的效果。该豁免检定的DC计算方式如下：

entries.name: 疾风连击
entries: 紧接在你于你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作之后，你可以消耗1点气以使用一个附赠动作进行二次徒手打击。

entries.name: 坚强防御
entries: 你可以在你的回合消耗1点气以使用一个附赠动作采取{@action 闪避}动作。

entries.name: 飞檐走壁
entries: 你可以在你的回合消耗1点气以使用一个附赠动作采取{@action 撤离}或{@action 疾走}动作，且你的跳跃距离在该回合变为二倍。

classFeatures.name: 无甲移动
entries: 从2级开始，当你未穿戴护甲或持用盾牌时，你的移动速度增加10呎。这个加值会在你升至特定武僧等级时提升，参见武僧表中的无甲移动栏位。
在9级时，你获得在你的回合移动期间，可以沿着垂直表面或横越水面移动而不至于摔落的能力。

classFeatures.name: 拨挡飞弹
entries: 从3级开始，当你被一次远程武器攻击命中时，你可以使用你的反应以拨挡或抓住该投射物。当你这么做时，你从该攻击所受到的伤害将被减少{@dice 1d10} + 你的敏捷调整值 + 你的武僧等级。
若你将该伤害降低至零，且若该投射物的大小能够被你单手抓住且你有至少一只空手，则你可以抓住该投射物。若你透过这个方式抓住一个投射物，你可以消耗1点气，做为你该次反应的一部份，使用你刚抓到的武器或弹药进行一次远程攻击（范围20/60）。无论你的武器熟练如何，你都熟练于该次攻击，且该投射物在此攻击中被视作武僧武器。

classFeatures.name: 宗派传承
entries: 当你升至3级时，你将投身于一种宗派传承，从可选宗派传承列表中选择。你的宗派将在3级、6级、11级、和17级时赋予你新的能力。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至4级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 轻身坠
entries: 从4级开始，当你坠落时，你可以使用你的反应以将任何你所受到的坠落伤害减少等同于你五倍武僧等级的数值。

classFeatures.name: 额外攻击
entries: 从5级开始，每当你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作，你可以攻击二次，而非一次。

classFeatures.name: 震慑拳
entries: 从5级开始，你可以干扰一个对手体内气的流动。当你以近战武器攻击命中另一个生物时，你可以消耗1点气以尝试进行一次震慑拳。目标必须成功通过一次体质豁免，否则被{@condition 震慑}直到你的下个回合结束。

classFeatures.name: 真气驻拳
entries: 从6级开始，在克服对非魔法攻击和伤害的抗性和免疫能力时，你的徒手打击被视作魔法武器。

classFeatures.name: 宗派传承能力
entries: 在6级时，你获得一个来自你宗派传承的能力。

classFeatures.name: 反射闪避
entries: 在7级时，你直觉性的灵活身法让你能够躲开某些范围效果，像是蓝龙的闪电吐息、或{@spell 火球术}法术。当你成为一个允许你进行敏捷豁免以仅承受一半伤害的效果的目标时，你改为在豁免成功时不受任何伤害，且在豁免失败时仅承受一半伤害。

classFeatures.name: 心头灭却
entries: 从7级开始，你可以使用你的动作以结束一个让你被{@condition 魅惑}或{@condition 恐惧}的效果。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至8级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 无甲移动强化
entries: 在9级时，你获得在你的回合移动期间，可以沿着垂直表面或横越水面移动而不至于摔落的能力。

classFeatures.name: 百病不侵
entries: 在10级时，流通于你周身的气让你免疫于疾病和毒素（包含中毒状态）。

classFeatures.name: 宗派传承能力
entries: 在11级时，你获得一个来自你宗派传承的能力。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至12级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 天语通
classFeatures.ENG_name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon
entries: 从13级开始，你习得接触其他心灵中的气魂，好让你理解所有被说出的语言。同时，任何理解至少一种语言的生物也都可以理解你所说的话。

classFeatures.name: 金刚魂
entries: 从14级开始，你对气的掌握让你熟练于所有的豁免检定。
此外，每当你进行一次豁免检定且豁免失败，你可以消耗1点气以重骰它并使用第二个掷骰结果。

classFeatures.name: 不朽身躯
entries: 在15级时，你体内的气将维持你免受任何衰老的弊害，且你不会被魔法变老。然而，你仍然会因为衰老而死亡。此外，你将不再需要食物和饮水。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至16级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 宗派传承能力
entries: 在17级时，你获得一个来自你宗派传承的能力。

classFeatures.name: 空灵体
entries: 从18级开始，你可以使用你的动作消耗4点气以变得{@condition 隐形}长达1分钟。在这段期间，你同时获得对除了力场伤害以外所有伤害的抗性。
此外，你可以消耗8点气以施放{@spell 星界投影}法术，无需材料构材。当你这么做时，你无法让任何其他生物跟你一起被投影至星界。

classFeatures.name: 属性值提升
entries: 当你在此职业升至19级时，你可以增加一项自选属性值2点，或着你可以增加二项自选属性值各1点。如同平常一样，你不能透过这个能力将一个属性值提升至超过20。
如果你的DM允许使用专长的话，你也可以改为获得一个{@5etools 专长|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 超凡魂
entries: 在20级时，当你骰先攻时且已经没有剩下的气时，你获得4点气。

subclassFeatures.name: 暗影宗
entries: 暗影宗的武僧们遵循着崇尚隐匿和诡计的传统。这些武僧也可以被称作忍者或是影舞者，并担当间谍和刺客的工作。有时一个忍者宗派的成员彼此都是家族成员，他们形成一个氏族，誓言将他们技艺与任务隐藏于黑暗中。至于其他宗派则可能更像是盗贼公会，提供他们的服务给贵族、富商、或任何付得起价格的对象。无论他们方式如何，这些宗派的首领都要求下属无条件的服从他们。

entries.name: 影之技艺
entries: 从你在3级时选择此宗派开始，你可以使用你的气以复制特定法术的效果。以一个动作，你可以消耗2点气以施放{@spell 黑暗术}、{@spell 黑暗视觉}、{@spell 行踪无迹}、或{@spell 沉默术}，且无须提供材料构材。此外，若你尚未知晓{@spell 次级幻象}戏法，则你将习得它。

entries.name: 暗影步
entries: 从6级开始，你获得穿梭于阴影之间的能力。当你处于微光光照或黑暗环境时，以一个附赠动作，你可以传送最多60呎距离到一处你所能看见，且同样处于微光光照或黑暗环境的未被占据空间。接着你在该回合结束前所进行的第一次近战攻击检定中具有优势。

entries.name: 暗影斗篷
entries: 从11级起，你学会如何与阴影融为一体。当你处于微光光照或黑暗环境时，你可以使用你的动作以变得{@condition 隐形}。你保持{@condition 隐形}状态直到你进行一次攻击、施放法术、或处于明亮光照的区域。

entries.name: 趁人之危
entries: 在17级时，你可以利用一个生物被攻击命中时所产生的瞬间分神。当一个距离你5呎内的生物被除你以外的另一个生物的攻击命中，你可以使用你的反应以对该生物进行一次近战攻击。

subclassFeatures.name: 散打宗
entries: 散打宗的武僧都是武术格斗的终极大师，无论是持武还是空手。他们学习推撞与绊摔对手的技巧、操作气以治疗他们身体所受的伤害、并施展能够保护他们不受伤害的深度冥想。

entries.name: 散打技巧
entries: 从你在3级时选择此宗派开始，你可以在你驾驭你自己体内气的同时操作你敌人的气。当你使用你疾风连击所赋予的其中一次攻击命中一个生物时，你可以对该目标强加下列其中一个效果。

items: 它必须成功通过一次敏捷豁免，否则被击倒{@condition 伏地}。
它必须进行一次力量豁免。若它豁免失败，则你可以将它推离你最多15呎距离。
它直到你的下个回合结束前都不能采取反应。

entries.name: 混元体
entries: 从6级起，你获得治疗你自己的能力。以一个动作，你可以回复等同于你武僧等级三倍的生命值。你必须完成一次长休之后才能再次使用此能力。

entries.name: 凝神境
entries: 从11级起，你可以进入一种特别的冥想以使你周遭环绕着一道和平灵光。在一次长休结束时，你将获得{@spell 圣域术}法术的效果，持续直到你的下一次长休开始（此法术可以和原本一样被提早结束）。此法术的豁免检定DC等同于8+你的感知调整值+你的熟练加值。
{@spell 圣域术}的效果如下：你守护射程内一个生物不受攻击。直到法术结束前，以被守护生物为目标进行攻击或施放危害法术的任何生物都必须先进行一次感知豁免。若豁免失败，该生物必须选择另一个目标，否则该次攻击或法术失败。此法术并不会从范围效果中保护被守护的生物，像是{@spell 火球术}。
若被守护的生物进行一次攻击、施放一个会影响敌人的法术、或对另一个生物造成伤害，则此法术结束。

entries.name: 震颤掌
entries: 从17级起，你获得在某人体内制造致命震颤的能力。当你以徒手打击命中一个生物时，你可以消耗3点气以让这阵难以察觉的震动在目标体内开始鼓动，持续等同于你武僧等级的天数。这阵震动是无害的，直到你使用你的动作以结束它。若要这么做，你与目标必须处于相同的存在位面。当你使用这个动作时，该生物必须进行一次体质豁免。若豁免失败，则它的生命值归零。若豁免成功，则它将受到{@dice 10d10}死灵伤害。
你只能同时让一个生物处于此能力的效果之下。你也可以选择无害的结束这阵震动，而无须使用动作。

subclassFeatures.name: 四象宗
entries: 你遵循着一个教导你驾驭元素之力的宗派传统。当你凝神运气时，你可以使你自己调和于创造和操纵四元素之力，如臂使指般驱使它们。这个宗派的部分成员投身於单一元素，而其它人则将四元素织为一体。
这个宗派的许多武僧会将他们气的象征纹在身上，常见的像是盘龙，或者诸如火凤、游鱼、古木、群山、奔浪等等。

entries.name: 元素门徒
entries: 当你在3级时选择此宗派时，你学会驾驭四元素力量的魔法法门。每种法门都会要求你在每次使用它的时候消耗气。
你知晓元素调律法门、以及另外一个你所选择的四象法门。你将在6级、11级、和17级时各学会一个你所选择的额外四象法门。
每当你学会一个新的四象法门，你也可以将其中一个你已知的四象法门替换成另一个不同的法门。

entries.name: 施放元素法术
entries: 有些四象法门会允许你施放法术。请参阅{@book 第十章|PHB|10}以了解关于施法的通用规则。要施放其中一个这些法术，你使用该法术的施法时间和其他规则，但你不需要为其提供材料构材。
一旦你在本职业升至5级时，你可以消耗额外的气以提升你透过四象法门所施放的法术的环阶，只要该法术在以更高法术位施放时具有升阶效果，例如{@spell 燃烧之手}。你每额外消耗1点气，就可以使该法术的环阶提升1环。举例来说，若你是一个5级武僧并使用飞焰击以施放{@spell 燃烧之手}，你可以消耗3点气以将此法术做为2环法术施放（该法门的基本消耗为2点气，加上额外的1点）。
你透过这个方式施放法术时所能消耗的气的最大值（包括它的基本消耗以及任何你用以提升其环阶所消耗的气）由你的武僧等级决定，如下列的法术与气表格所示。在5级时，你可以消耗最多3点气；这个数值会在9级时增加到4点气；13级时5点；和17级时6点。

entries.caption: 法术与气
colLabels: 单一法术消耗气的最大值
rows: 5级-8级

entries.name: 四象法门
entries: 这些四象法门将在以下按照等级需求（然后按照字母顺序）排列呈现。若某个法门要求特定等级，则你必须在此职业中达到该等级才能够学习这个法门。

entries.name: 元素调律
entries: 你可以使用你的动作以简单地控制距离你30呎内的元素之力，造成下列其中一个你所选择的效果：

items: 创造出一个与气、土、火、或水有关，即效而无害的感官效果，像是火花飞溅、清风吹拂、轻烟飘散、或岩石轻微地隆隆作响。
立刻点亮或熄灭一根蜡烛、火炬、或一处小型篝火。
冷却或温热最多1磅的非活物物质长达最多1小时。
使一片可容纳于1呎边长立方体内的土、火、水、或雾以自我形塑成你指定的粗糙形状，长达1分钟。

entries.name: 火蛇利牙
entries: 当你在你的回合使用{@action 攻击}动作时，你可以消耗1点气以让烈焰触手从你的拳脚延伸而出。你徒手打击的触及范围在该动作以及该回合结束前视为增加10呎。这类攻击在命中时将造成火焰伤害，而非钝击伤害。且若你在攻击命中时消耗1点气，它将造成额外的{@dice 1d10}火焰伤害。

entries.name: 四雷拳
entries: 你可以消耗2点气以施放{@spell 雷鸣波}。

entries.name: 凝气刚拳
entries: 你可以创造出一道凝聚空气所形成的爆风并使它如拳头猛力打击敌人。以一个动作，你可以消耗2点气并选择一个距离你30呎内的生物。该生物必须进行一次力量豁免。若豁免失败，该生物将受到{@dice 3d10}钝击伤害，加上你每额外消耗一点气的额外{@dice 1d10}钝击伤害，且你可以将它推离你最多20呎距离并将它击倒{@condition 伏地}。若豁免成功，该生物只受到一半的伤害，且你无法推动它或将它击倒{@condition 伏地}。

entries.name: 风灵突进
entries: 你可以消耗2点气以施放{@spell 造风术}。

entries.name: 形塑流川
entries: 以一个动作，你可以消耗1点气以选择一片距离你120呎内，各边不超过30呎的冰或水的区域。你可以将该区域内的水变成冰，反之亦可，且你可以将区域内的冰重塑成任何你想要的样子。你可以升高或降低冰的海拔高度、创造或填满一道沟壑，升起或移平一道墙、或形成一根立柱。任何这类变化的程度都不能超过这片区域最大边长的一半。举例来说，若你影响了一片30呎平方的方形区域，你可以创造出一个最多15呎高的立柱、将这片方形区域的高度提升或降低最多15呎、或挖掘一道最多15呎深的沟壑，诸如此类。你无法透过形塑冰以困住或伤害位于区域内的生物。

entries.name: 飞炎击
entries: 你可以消耗2点气以施放{@spell 燃烧之手}。

entries.name: 清流鞭
entries: 你可以消耗2点气，并以一个动作创造出一条流水长鞭推拉目标使其失衡。一个距离你30呎内且你所能看见的生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。若豁免失败，该生物将受到{@dice 3d10}钝击伤害，加上你每额外消耗一点气的额外{@dice 1d10}钝击伤害，且你可以将它击倒{@condition 伏地}或将它向你拉近最多25呎距离。若豁免成功，该生物只受到一半的伤害，且你无法拉动它或将它击倒{@condition 伏地}。

entries.name: 北风之握 (需求6级)
entries: 你可以消耗3点气以施放{@spell 人类定身术}。

entries.name: 狮吼功 (需求6级)
entries: 你可以消耗3点气以施放{@spell 粉碎音波}。

entries.name: 凤凰火 (需求11级)
entries: 你可以消耗4点气以施放{@spell 火球术}。

entries.name: 云雾式 (需求11级)
entries: 你可以消耗4点气以施放{@spell 气化形体}，以你自己为目标。

entries.name: 攀云步 (需求11级)
entries: 你可以消耗4点气以施放{@spell 飞行术}，以你自己为目标。

entries.name: 寒冬之息 (需求17级)
entries: 你可以消耗6点气以施放{@spell 寒冰锥}。

entries.name: 苍山庇佑 (需求17级)
entries: 你可以消耗5点气以施放{@spell 石肤术}，以你自己为目标。

entries.name: 噬焰流 (需求17级)
entries: 你可以消耗5点气以施放{@spell 火墙术}。

entries.name: 滚石浪 (需求17级)
entries: 你可以消耗6点气以施放{@spell 石墙术}。

entries.name: 额外四象法门
entries: 在6级时，你学会一个你所选择的额外四象法门。
每当你学会一个新的四象法门，你也可以将其中一个你已知的四象法门替换成另一个不同的法门。

entries.name: 额外四象法门
entries: 在11级时，你学会一个你所选择的额外四象法门。
每当你学会一个新的四象法门，你也可以将其中一个你已知的四象法门替换成另一个不同的法门。

entries.name: 额外四象法门
entries: 在17级时，你学会一个你所选择的额外四象法门。
每当你学会一个新的四象法门，你也可以将其中一个你已知的四象法门替换成另一个不同的法门。

subclassFeatures.name: 永亡宗
entries: 永亡宗的武僧痴心于死亡的意义和机制。他们俘虏生物并用精心准备的实验去捕捉、记录、并理解他们死亡的瞬间。他们利用这些知识去指导他们的武术，从而产生了致命的战斗风格。

entries.name: 死之触
entries: 从你在3级时选择此宗派开始，你对于死亡的研究让你得以在另一个生物濒临死亡时抽取它的生命力。当你将一个距离你5呎内的生物的生命值归零时，你将获得等同于你感知调整值+你武僧等级的临时生命值（最少1点临时生命值）。

entries.name: 索命之时
entries: 在6级时，由于你的灵魂已经被死亡的阴影所影响，你得到以一个动作让你周遭人们动摇或恐惧的能力。当你采取这个动作时，每个距离你30呎内且能看见你的生物必须成功通过一次感知豁免，否则被你{@condition 恐惧}直到你的下个回合结束。

entries.name: 掌握生死
entries: 从11级开始，你利用你对死亡的熟悉以逃离它的魔掌。当你的生命值被归零时，你可以消耗1点气（无须动作）以改为保有1点生命值。

entries.name: 长眠触
entries: 从17级开始，你的触碰可以将死亡的能量导入一个生物体内。以一个动作，你触碰一个距离你5呎内的生物，且你消耗1到10点气。目标必须进行一次体质豁免，若该豁免失败则受到每一点被消耗的气{@dice 2d10}的死灵伤害，豁免成功则只受到一半的伤害。.

subclassFeatures.name: Way of the Sun Soul
entries: Monks of the Way of the Sun Soul learn to channel their own life energy into searing bolts of light. They teach that meditation can unlock the ability to unleash the indomitable light shed by the soul of every living creature.

entries.name: Radiant Sun Bolt
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can hurl searing bolts of magical radiance.

You gain a ranged spell attack that you can use with the {@action Attack} action. The attack has a range of 30 feet. You are proficient with it, and you add your Dexterity modifier to its attack and damage rolls. Its damage is radiant, and its damage die is a {@dice d4}. This die changes as you gain monk levels—to a {@dice d6} at 5th level, a {@dice d8} at 11th level, and a {@dice d10} at 17th level.
When you use the {@action Attack} action on your turn to use this special attack, you can spend 1 ki point to make two additional attacks with it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Searing Arc Strike
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to channel your ki into searing waves of energy. Immediately after you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can spend 2 ki points to cast the 1st-level spell {@spell burning hands} as a bonus action.

You can spend additional ki points to cast {@spell burning hands} as a higher level spell. Each additional ki point you spend increases the spell's level by 1. The maximum number of ki points (2 plus any additional points) that you can spend on the spell equals half your monk level (round down).

entries.name: Searing Sunburst
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to create an orb of light that erupts into a devastating explosion. As an action, you magically create an orb and hurl it at a point you choose within 150 feet, where it erupts into a sphere of radiant light for a brief but deadly instant.

Each creature in that 20-foot radius sphere must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 2d6} radiant damage. A creature doesn't need to make the save if the creature is behind total cover that is opaque.
You can increase the sphere's damage by spending ki points. Each point you spend, up to a maximum of 3, increases the damage by {@dice 2d6}.

entries.name: Sun Shield
entries: At 17th level, you become wreathed in a magical, luminous aura. You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can extinguish or restore the light as a bonus action.
If a creature hits you with a melee attack while this light shines, you can use your reaction to deal radiant damage to the creature. The radiant damage equals 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeatures.name: Way of the Kensei
entries: Monks of the Way of Kensei train relentlessly with their weapons, to the point that the weapon becomes like an extension of the body. A kensei sees a weapon in much the same way a painter regards a brush or a writer sees parchment, ink, and quill. A sword or bow is a tool used to express the beauty and elegance of the martial arts. That such mastery makes a kensei a peerless warrior and is but a side effect of intense devotion, practice, and study.

entries.name: Path of the Kensei
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you learn to extend your knowledge of the martial arts beyond the standard array of monk weapons.
You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with three martial weapons of your choice. A martial weapon is considered a kensei weapon for you if you're proficient with it.

Whenever you wield a kensei weapon, you choose whether to use Dexterity or Strength for the attack and damage rolls of the weapon, and you choose whether to use your Martial Arts damage die in place of the weapon's damage die.

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn and hit a target with a kensei weapon, you can use a bonus action to pummel the target, dealing an additional {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage to that target and to any other target you hit with the weapon as part of the Attack.

If you make an unarmed strike as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn and are holding a kensei weapon, you can use that weapon to defend yourself. You gain a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn while you are not {@condition incapacitated} and the weapon is in your hand.

entries.name: One with the Blade
entries: At 6th level, you extend your ki into the weapons you hold, granting you the following benefits:

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Your attacks with your kensei weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

entries.name: Precise Strike
entries: You can focus your attention on a single target in battle to understand and overcome its defenses. As a bonus action, pick one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The next weapon attack you make against that creature during the current turn adds double your proficiency bonus to the attack roll, rather than your normal proficiency bonus. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Sharpen the Blade
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to augment your weapons with the strength of your ki. As a bonus action, you can expend up to 3 ki points to grant a weapon you touch a bonus to attack and damage rolls while you wield it. The bonus equals the number of ki points you spent. This bonus lasts for 1 minute.

entries.name: Unerring Accuracy
entries: At 17th level, your mastery of weapons grants you extraordinary accuracy. On each of your turns, you can reroll one weapon attack roll you make that misses.

subclassFeatures.name: Way of the Kensei v2
entries: Monks of the Way of Kensei train relentlessly with their weapons, to the point that the weapon becomes like an extension of the body. A kensei sees a weapon in much the same way a painter regards a brush or a writer sees parchment, ink, and quill. A sword or bow is a tool used to express the beauty and elegance of the martial arts. That such mastery makes a kensei a peerless warrior is but a side effect of intense devotion, practice, and study.

entries.name: Path of the Kensei
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you learn to extend your knowledge of the martial arts beyond the standard array of monk weapons.
You gain the following benefits:

items: Choose two types of weapons to be your kensei weapons: one melee weapon and one ranged weapon. Each of these weapons can be any simple or martial weapon that lacks the heavy and special properties. The longbow is also a valid choice. You gain proficiency with these weapons if you don't already have it. Weapons of the chosen types are monk weapons for you. Many of this tradition's features work only with your kensei weapons. When you reach 6th, 11th, and 17th level in this class, you can choose another type of weapon—melee or ranged—to be a kensei weapon for you, following the criteria above.

If you make an unarmed strike as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn and are holding a kensei weapon, you can use it to defend yourself if it is a melee weapon. You gain a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, while the weapon is in your hand and you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

You can use a bonus action on your turn to make your ranged attacks with a kensei weapon more deadly. When you do so, any target you hit with a ranged attack using a kensei weapon takes an extra {@dice 1d4} damage of the weapon's type. You retain this benefit until the end of the current turn.

entries.name: One with the Blade
entries: At 6th level, you extend your ki into the weapons you hold, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Magic Kensei Weapons
entries: Your attacks with your kensei weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

entries.name: Precise Strike
entries: When you hit a target with a kensei weapon, you can spend 1 ki point to cause the weapon to deal extra damage to the target equal to your Martial Arts die. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

entries.name: Sharpen the Blade
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to augment your weapons with the strength of your ki. As a bonus action, you can expend up to 3 ki points to grant one kensei weapon you touch a bonus to attack and damage rolls while you wield it. The bonus equals the number of ki points you spent. This bonus lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

entries.name: Unerring Accuracy
entries: At 17th level, your mastery of weapons grants you extraordinary accuracy. If you make an attack roll with a monk weapon and miss, you can reroll it. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

subclassFeatures.name: Way of Tranquility
entries: Monks of the Way of Tranquility see violence as a last resort. They use diplomacy, mercy, and understanding to resolve conflicts. If pushed, though, they are capable warriors who can bring an end to the unjust or cruel folk who refuse to listen to reason. When adventuring, these monks make excellent diplomats. They are also skilled in the healing arts, and can preserve their allies in the face of daunting foes.

entries.name: Path of Tranquility
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can become an island of calm in even the most chaotic of situations. With this feature, you can cast the {@spell sanctuary} spell on yourself, no material component required, and it lasts up to 8 hours. Its saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to this effect for 1 hour.
Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again for 1 minute.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: Your mystical touch can heal wounds. Starting at 3rd level, you have a pool of magical healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your monk level × 10.
As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in the pool.

Instead of healing the creature, you can expend 5 hit points from your pool of healing to cure the target of one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it. You can cure multiple diseases and neutralize multiple poisons with a single use of Healing Hands, expending hit points separately for each one.
When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can replace one of the unarmed strikes with a use of this feature.
This feature has no effect on undead and constructs.

entries.name: Emissary of Peace
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to diffuse violent situations. Whenever you make a Charisma check to calm violent emotions or to counsel peace, you have advantage on the roll. You must make this entreaty in good faith; it doesn't apply if proficiency in the {@skill Deception} or {@skill Intimidation} skill applies to your check.
You also gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance} or {@skill Persuasion} skill (choose one).

entries.name: Douse the Flames of War
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to temporarily extinguish a creature's violent impulses. As an action, you can touch a creature, and it must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. The target automatically succeeds if it's missing any of its hit points. If the target fails the save, it can't attack for 1 minute. During that time, it also can't cast spells that deal damage or that force someone to make a saving throw.
This effect ends if the target is attacked, takes damage, or is forced to make a saving throw or if the target witnesses any of those things happening to its allies.

entries.name: Anger of a Gentle Soul
entries: At 17th level, you gain the ability to visit vengeance on someone who fells others. If you see a creature reduce another creature to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to grant yourself a bonus to all damage rolls against the aggressor until the end of your next turn. The bonus equals your monk level.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Way of the Drunken Master
entries: The Way of the Drunken Master teaches its students to move with the jerky, unpredictable movements of a drunkard. A drunken master sways, tottering on unsteady feet, to present what seems like an incompetent combatant but proves frustrating to engage. The drunken master's erratic stumbles conceal a carefully executed dance of blocks, parries, advances, attacks, and retreats. Cunning warriors can see through the drunken master's apparent incompetence to recognize the masterful technique employed.

entries.name: Drunken Technique
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance} skill if you don't already have it; your martial arts technique mixes martial training with the precision of a dancer and the antics of a jester.

You also learn how to twist and turn quickly as part of your Flurry of Blows. Whenever you use Flurry of Blows, you gain the benefit of the {@action Disengage} action, and your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the current turn.

entries.name: Tipsy Sway
entries: At 6th level, your swaying in combat becomes maddeningly unpredictable. As a reaction when an enemy misses you with a melee attack roll, you can cause that attack to hit one creature of your choice, other than the attacker, that you can see within 5 feet of you. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Drunkard's Luck
entries: Starting at 11th level, you always seem to get a lucky bounce at just the right moment to save you from doom. When you make a saving throw, you can spend 1 ki point to give yourself advantage on that roll. You must decide to use this feature before rolling.

entries.name: Intoxicated Frenzy
entries: At 17th level, you gain the ability to make an overwhelming number of attacks against a group of enemies. When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can make up to three additional attacks with it (up to a total of five attacks), provided that each Flurry of Blows attack targets a different creature this turn.

subclassFeatures.name: 醉拳宗
entries: 醉拳宗教导其学徒以醉汉那愚蠢、不可预测的行动方式来进行移动。一个醉拳大师总是摇摇晃晃、蹒跚摇摆着他的双脚，以呈现出一个不尽人意，看似无能的战斗者。 然而在他们飘忽不定的跌撞之下，实则隐藏着一段被精心执行的舞蹈，揉合了阻挡、招架、推进、攻击、和撤退等动作。
醉拳大师常常喜欢装疯卖傻，为沮丧者带来欢乐，或对傲慢者展现出谦卑。但当他们加入战斗时，醉拳大师将会是一名令人恼怒、无比狡诈的敌人。

entries.name: 额外熟练
entries: 当你在3级时选择此宗派时，若你尚未熟练于{@skill 表演}技能，你将获得它的熟练。你的武术技巧将战斗训练混合了舞者的精确和小丑的滑稽。同时，若你尚未熟练于{@item 酿酒师设备|phb}，你也将获得它的熟练。

entries.name: 醉拳技巧
entries: 在3级时，你学会如何在疾风连击中快速的翻转扭动。每当你使用疾风连击时，你将获得{@action 撤离}动作的好处，且直到该回合结束前，你的步行速度将增加10呎。

entries.name: 微醺摇摆
entries: 从6级开始，你可以透过突然地摆动来移动。你获得下列好处：

entries.name: 鲤鱼打挺
entries: 当你处于{@condition 伏地}状态时，你可以借由消耗5呎移动速度力来起身，而非消耗你移动速度的一半。

entries.name: 借力打力
entries: 当一个生物对你进行的一次近战攻击检定失手时，你能够以一个反应消耗1点气以使该攻击命中一个你所选择的，距离你5呎内且你所能看见的攻击者以外的生物。

entries.name: 醉汉机运
entries: 从11级开始，你似乎总是能在最正确的时刻突然获得好运。当你进行一次属性检定、攻击检定、或豁免检定，且在该检定中具有劣势时，你可以消耗2点气以取消该检定中的劣势。

entries.name: 酒疯狂醉
entries: 在17级时，你获得对一群敌人进行惊人数量的攻击的能力。当你使用疾风连击时，只要该回合的每次疾风连击都以一个不同的生物做为目标，你就可以进行最多三次的额外攻击（最多总共五次的疾风连击攻击）。

subclassFeatures.name: 剑圣宗
entries: 剑圣宗的武僧持续于他们武器的训练，甚至达到了「武器即为身体的延伸」这一境界。在精通剑术的基础上，这个宗派也涉猎了诸多不同的武器。
武器之于剑圣，就如同画笔之于画家、笔墨之于文人。剑圣将其视为用来展现武道之美的工具。这样的信念使剑圣成为了无与伦比的武者，但这也不过只是他们那专注投入、锻炼、和钻研的副作用罢了。

entries.name: 剑圣之途
entries: 当你在3级时选择此宗派时，你特殊的武术训练让精通于你特定武器的使用。这条道途同时也包括了书画技艺的指导。你获得下列好处。

entries.name: 剑圣武器
entries: 选择二种武器做为你的剑圣武器：一种近战武器和一种远程武器。这些武器可以是任何没有重型或特殊属性的简易或军用武器，包括长弓也是可选选项之一。若你尚未熟练于这些武器，则你获得它们的熟练。所选的武器种类对你而言将被视为武僧武器。这个宗派的许多能力都只会作用于你的剑圣武器。当你在此职业升至6级、11级、和17级时，你可以遵循上述的条件，再选择另一种武器种类—近战或远程皆可—做为你的剑圣武器。

entries.name: 灵巧格档
entries: 若你在你的回合以{@action 攻击}动作的一部份进行了一次徒手打击，且你正持握一把剑圣武器，则若该武器是一把近战武器，你将可以用它来保护自己。当该武器在你中且你未陷入{@condition 无力}状态，你的AC获得+2加值直到你的下个回合开始。

entries.name: 剑圣神射
entries: 你可以在你的回合使用一个附赠动作让你透过剑圣武器所进行远程攻击变得更加致命。当你这么做时，任何被你以剑圣武器所进行的远程攻击命中的目标将会受到额外的{@dice 1d4}该武器伤害类型的伤害。你保留这个好处直到该回合结束。

entries.name: 书画之道
entries: 你从{@item 书法家设备|phb}或{@item 画家设备|phb}中选择并获得其中一项的熟练。

entries.name: 人剑合一
entries: 在6级时，你将你的气延展至你的剑圣武器中，赋予你下列好处。

entries.name: 魔法剑圣武器
entries: 在克服对非魔法攻击和伤害的抗性和免疫能力时，你以剑圣武器所进行的攻击被视作魔法攻击。

entries.name: 机敏打击
entries: 当你以剑圣武器命中一个目标时，你可以消耗1点气以让该武器对目标造成等同于你武艺骰的额外伤害。你只能在你的每个回合使用这个能力一次。

entries.name: 锋锐剑刃
entries: 在11级时，你获得以你的气进一步增强你武器的能力。以一个附赠动作，你可以消耗最多3点气并触碰一把剑圣武器，以让你在使用它进行攻击时的攻击检定和伤害骰中获得加值。这个加值等同于你所消耗的气的数量。这个加值将持续1分钟，或直到你再次使用这个能力。这个能力对已经具有攻击检定和伤害骰加值的魔法武器没有任何效果。

entries.name: 神准精确
entries: 在17级时，你在武器上的精熟赋予你超凡的准确度。若你在你的回合以一把武僧武器所进行的攻击检定失手，你可以重骰该检定。你只能在你的每个回合使用这个能力一次。

subclassFeatures.name: 日魂宗
entries: 日魂宗的武僧学会如何将自己的生命能量引导转换成炽热的光芒。他们被教导使用一种特殊的冥想方式，让其能解放将存在于每一个活物灵魂中的不灭光芒释放而出的能力。

entries.name: 日光箭
entries: 从你在3级时选择此宗派开始，你可以投掷出灼热的魔法光辉箭矢。
你获得可以在采取{@action 攻击}动作时使用的新的攻击选项。这种特殊攻击是一个射程为30呎的远程法术攻击。你熟练于此攻击，且你将你的敏捷调整值加入它的攻击检定和伤害骰。它的伤害类型为光耀伤害，且它的伤害骰为一颗{@dice d4}。这颗骰子会随着你提升武僧等级时变化，参见武僧表中的武艺栏位。
当你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作并使用此特殊攻击做为攻击动作的一部份，你可以消耗1点气以使用一个附赠动作进行二次此特殊攻击。
当你获得额外攻击能力，此特殊攻击可以被用于任何你做为{@action 攻击}动作一部份所进行的攻击中。

entries.name: 热弧袭
entries: 在6级时，你获得将你的气引导转换成灼热能量波的能力。紧接在你在你的回合采取{@action 攻击}动作之后，你可以消耗2点气以一个附赠动作施放{@spell 燃烧之手}法术。
你可以消耗额外的气以将{@spell 燃烧之手}做为更高环阶的法术施放。你每额外消耗1点气，就可以使该法术的环阶提升1环。你在该法术上所能消耗的气的最大值（2+任意额外点气）等同于你武僧等级的一半。

entries.name: 炽热爆阳
entries: 在11级时，你获得创造出一个将爆发出毁灭爆炸的光球的能力。以一个动作，你将用魔法创造出一个光球，并将它投掷到150呎内你所选择的一点，它将在该处爆发成一个瞬间而致命的光辉球体。
每个处于该20呎半径球体范围内的生物都必须成功通过一次体质豁免，否则受到{@dice 2d6}光耀伤害。一个生物若处于不透光全掩护后方，则它将不需要进行此豁免检定。
你可以借由消耗额外的气以增加这个球体的伤害。你每消耗1点气就可以增加{@dice 2d6}伤害，最多消耗3点。

entries.name: 辉日护盾
entries: 在17级时，你被一道散发光芒的魔法灵光给环绕。你将散发出30呎半径的明亮光照以及再延伸30呎半径的微光光照。你能够以一个附赠动作熄灭或恢复这道光芒。
若一个生物在这道光芒照耀时以一次近战攻击命中你，你可以使用你的反应以对该生物造成光耀伤害。这个光耀伤害等同于5+你的感知调整值。

subclassFeatures.name: Way of the Soul Knife (Livestream)
entries: {@i Transcribed on 2018-10-13. [Square bracketed text] denotes transcriber's annotations.}

Monks of the Way of the Soul Knife are deadly assassins and bounty hunters. They use their psionic talents to manifest psionic blades that tear through their enemies' bodies and psychic auras. Their talents extend beyond combat, as their ability to perceive auras allows them to track down foes and see through their deceptions.

entries.name: Soul Knife
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can use your psionic energy to manifest blades that disrupt your foes' minds.
Your unarmed strikes deal your choice of psychic, piercing, slashing, or bludgeoning damage each time you hit.
In addition, you can use a bonus action to increase the reach of your unarmed strikes by 30 feet until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Psychic Slash
entries: At 3rd level, when you channel ki into your attacks you augment your soul knives to inflict devastating psionic attacks.
Whenever you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows and that attack inflicts psychic damage, you can impose one of the following effects on the target:

entries.name: Life Drain
entries: You gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage your attack deals.

entries.name: Invoke Terror
entries: The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Invoke Wrath
entries: The target suffers disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Astral Slide
entries: You teleport the target up to 10 feet to a destination you can see.

entries.name: Synaptic Overload
entries: The target gains vulnerability to psychic damage until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Aura Sight
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to perceive the auras of other creatures.

As an action, select a creature that you can see. That creature makes a Wisdom saving throw, though it has no knowledge that you forced it to attempt this saving throw. On a failed save, you learn if the creature shares and aspects of its alignment with you, its current hit points, and its current attitude and intentions toward you or one other creature, object, or location of your choice. In addition, for the next 24 hours or until you use this ability again, you can use an action to determine the creature's distance and direction from you.
If a creature succeeds on its saving throw against this ability, you cannot use this ability against that creature again until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Spectral Blades
entries: At 11th level, you can cause your blades to phase through physical objects and defenses.

Once during your turn, you can choose to forego one unarmed strike in place of forcing a creature within the reach of that attack to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, it takes your unarmed strike's damage, or half that damage if it succeeds.

entries.name: Psychic Form
entries: At 17th level, you can transform your physical body into the same psychic energy that comprises your soul knives. As a bonus action, you gain resistance to all types of damage, a fly speed of 30 feet, and the ability to pass through solid objects but not end your movement within them. This benefit lasts for 1 minute. You cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

Her fists a blur as they deflect an incoming hail of arrows, a half-elf springs over a barricade and throws herself into the massed ranks of hobgoblins on the other side. She whirls among them, knocking their blows aside and sending them reeling, until at last she stands alone.
Taking a deep breath, a human covered in tattoos settles into a battle stance. As the first charging orcs reach him, he exhales and a blast of fire roars from his mouth, engulfing his foes.

Moving with the silence of the night, a black-clad halfling steps into a shadow beneath an arch and emerges from another inky shadow on a balcony a stone's throw away. She slides her blade free of its cloth-wrapped scabbard and peers through the open window at the tyrant prince, so vulnerable in the grip of sleep.

Whatever their discipline, monks are united in their ability to magically harness the energy that flows in their bodies. Whether channeled as a striking display of combat prowess or a subtler focus of defensive ability and speed, this energy infuses all that a monk does.

entries.name: The Magic of Ki
entries: Monks make careful study of a magical energy that most monastic traditions call ki. This energy is an element of the magic that suffuses the multiverse—specifically, the element that flows through living bodies. Monks harness this power within themselves to create magical effects and exceed their bodies' physical capabilities, and some of their special attacks can hinder the flow of ki in their opponents. Using this energy, monks channel uncanny speed and strength into their unarmed strikes. As they gain experience, their martial training and their mastery of ki gives them more power over their bodies and the bodies of their foes.

entries.name: Training and Asceticism
entries: Small walled cloisters dot the landscapes of the worlds of D&D, tiny refuges from the flow of ordinary life, where time seems to stand still. The monks who live there seek personal perfection through contemplation and rigorous training. Many entered the monastery as children, sent to live there when their parents died, when food couldn't be found to support them, or in return for some kindness that the monks had performed for their families.

Some monks live entirely apart from the surrounding population, secluded from anything that might impede their spiritual progress. Others are sworn to isolation, emerging only to serve as spies or assassins at the command of their leader, a noble patron, or some other mortal or divine power.

The majority of monks don't shun their neighbors, making frequent visits to nearby towns or villages and exchanging their service for food and other goods. As versatile warriors, monks often end up protecting their neighbors from monsters or tyrants.

For a monk, becoming an adventurer means leaving a structured, communal lifestyle to become a wanderer. This can be a harsh transition, and monks don't undertake it lightly. Those who leave their cloisters take their work seriously, approaching their adventures as personal tests of their physical and spiritual growth. As a rule, monks care little for material wealth and are driven by a desire to accomplish a greater mission than merely slaying monsters and plundering their treasure.

entries.name: Creating a Monk
entries: As you make your monk character, think about your connection to the monastery where you learned your skills and spent your formative years. Were you an orphan or a child left on the monastery's threshold? Did your parents promise you to the monastery in gratitude for a service performed by the monks? Did you enter this secluded life to hide from a crime you committed? Or did you choose the monastic life for yourself?

Consider why you left. Did the head of your monastery choose you for a particularly important mission beyond the cloister? Perhaps you were cast out because of some violation of the community's rules. Did you dread leaving, or were you happy to go? Is there something you hope to accomplish outside the monastery? Are you eager to return to your home?
As a result of the structured life of a monastic community and the discipline required to harness ki, monks are almost always lawful in alignment.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a monk quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Dexterity your highest ability score, followed by Wisdom. Second, choose the {@background hermit} background.
Do not mistake my silence for acceptance of your villainy. While you blustered and threatened, I've planned four different ways to snap your neck with my bare hands.

Monks walk a path of contradiction. They study their art as a wizard does, and like a wizard, they wear no armor and typically eschew weapons. Yet they are deadly combatants, their abilities on a par with those of a raging barbarian or a superbly trained fighter. Monks embrace this seeming contradiction, for it speaks to the core of all monastic study. By coming to know oneself completely, one learns much of the wider world.

A monk's focus on inner mastery leads many such individuals to become detached from society, more concerned with their personal experience than with happenings elsewhere. Adventuring monks are a rare breed of an already rare type of character, taking their quest for perfection beyond the walls of the monastery into the world at large.
Playing a monk character offers many intriguing opportunities to try something different. To distinguish your monk character even further, consider the options in the sections that follow.

entries.name: Monastery
entries: A monk studies in a monastery in preparation for a life of asceticism. Most of those who enter a monastery make it their home for the rest of their lives, with the exception of adventurers and others who have reason to leave. For those individuals, a monastery might serve as a refuge between excursions to the world or as a source of support in times of need.
What sort of place was your monastery, and where is it located? Did attending it contribute to your experience in an unusual or distinctive way?

entries.caption: Monastery
rows: Your monastery is carved out of a mountainside, where it looms over a treacherous pass.
Your monastery is high in the branches of an immense tree in the Feywild.
Your monastery was founded long ago by a cloud giant and is inside a cloud castle that can be reached only by flying.
Your monastery is built beside a volcanic system of hot springs, geysers, and sulfur pools. You regularly received visits from azer traders.
Your monastery was founded by gnomes and is an underground labyrinth of tunnels and rooms.
Your monastery was carved from an iceberg in the frozen reaches of the world.

entries.name: Icon
entries: Even in the monastic lifestyle, which eschews materialism and personal possessions, symbolism plays an important part in defining the identity of an order. Some monastic orders treat certain creatures with special regard, either because the creature is tied to the order's history or because it serves as an example of a quality the monks seek to emulate.

If your character's monastery had a special icon, you might wear a crude image of the creature somewhere inconspicuous on your clothing to serve as an identifying mark. Or perhaps your order's icon does not have a physical form but is expressed through a gesture or a posture that you adopt, and which other monks might know how to interpret.

entries.caption: Icon
rows: Monkey. Quick reflexes and the ability to travel through the treetops are two of the reasons why your order admires the monkey.
Dragon Turtle. The monks of your seaside monastery venerate the dragon turtle, reciting ancient prayers and offering garlands of flowers to honor this living spirit of the sea.
Ki-rin. Your monastery sees its main purpose as watching over and protecting the land in the manner of the ki-rin.
Owlbear. The monks of your monastery revere a family of owlbears and have coexisted with them for generations.
Hydra. Your order singles out the hydra for its ability to unleash several attacks simultaneously.
Dragon. A dragon once laired within your monastery. Its influence remains long after its departure.

entries.name: Master
entries: During your studies, you were likely under the tutelage of a master who imparted to you the precepts of the order. Your master was the one most responsible for shaping your understanding of the martial arts and your attitude toward the world. What sort of person was your master, and how did your relationship with your master affect you?

entries.caption: Master
rows: Your master was a tyrant whom you had to defeat in single combat to complete your instruction.
Your master was kindly and taught you to pursue the cause of peace.
Your master was merciless in pushing you to your limits. You nearly lost an eye during one especially brutal practice session.
Your master seemed goodhearted while tutoring you, but betrayed your monastery in the end.
Your master was cold and distant. You suspect that the two of you might be related.
Your master was kind and generous, never critical of your progress. Nevertheless, you feel you never fully lived up to the expectations placed on you.
